title: India's Savings Dilemma! #investing #assetallocation
summary: Despite a growing economy, household savings in India are surprisingly low. Both RBI data and our recent survey confirm this trend. But it's not just the quantity of savings that's a concern; it's also where those savings are allocated.
fullContent: Despite a growing economy, household savings in India are surprisingly low. Both RBI data and our recent survey confirm this trend. But it's not just the quantity of savings that's a concern; it's also where those savings are allocated. #MarcellusPodcast #IndiaSavings #AssetAllocation #PersonalFinance #HouseholdFinance

title: The Shocking Truths our Survey Reveals About Affluent Indian Households!
summary: The current state of household finances in India presents several interesting patterns that warrant a closer look. In this episode, we delve into critical questions based on recent data: 1. What factors contribute to net household financial savings reaching a 50-year low of 5%?
fullContent: The current state of household finances in India presents several interesting patterns that warrant a closer look. In this episode, we delve into critical questions based on recent data: 1. What factors contribute to net household financial savings reaching a 50-year low of 5%? 2. How does India's household debt, at 34% of income (excluding home loans), fit into the broader economic picture? 3. Despite a significant increase in demat accounts, why has the base of income taxpayers remained consistent? 4. What implications does the rise of AI hold for affluent individuals? To understand the complexities Affluent Indians face, we collaborated with Dun and Bradstreet on a comprehensive survey. Join us for an in-depth analysis of its findings.
